Answer: Streaming has already taken over television. I have not watched a local broadcast or cable channel in over 15 years. I would say cable cutting is already picking up in popularity.I have enjoyed it a lot. I can watch things when and where I want to. I don’t have to wait for the news to find out what has happened. I can go on a long vacation and come back to the same point I saved a film and pick up where I left off.Or I can have my tv disconnected for a year and not think about it.

Answer: The TV industry has changed dramatically due to the constant development of innovations, especially over the past 10 to 15 years. For example, Netflix, Roku, Amazon Prime, Hulu, and digital channels and devices are massive within the media and television industries. Now, it’s the period of the most growing Connected TV and OTT popularity, which speeds the changes in the TV industry. The future innovations are:1. Freedom to ChooseIn contrast with Linear TV, CTV/OTT proposes an enormous number of different channels. If you have a cable TV you have to watch the list of the standard programs and yThe TV industry has changed dramatically due to the constant development of innovations, especially over the past 10 to 15 years. For example, Netflix, Roku, Amazon Prime, Hulu, and digital channels and devices are massive within the media and television industries. Now, it’s the period of the most growing Connected TV and OTT popularity, which speeds the changes in the TV industry. The future innovations are:1. Freedom to ChooseIn contrast with Linear TV, CTV/OTT proposes an enormous number of different channels. If you have a cable TV you have to watch the list of the standard programs and you don’t have any possibilities to choose what you want. Moreover, you can watch programs only due to the schedule or you miss it. When you’re a happy CTV owner it’s really easy to find your preferable content and even download it. Additionally, CTV/OTT creates a list of proposals based on your preferences. More and more video content creators start their own Connected TV channels. If you’re already had it and want to share it with a larger audience,2. Commercials Become AntiquatedStreaming-service providers are proving that it's really possible to create and grow successful enterprises around a business model that includes little or no revenue from commercials. The trend is now changing to one based on a subscription model. It’s likely that even traditional cable providers will become subscription services.3. More InteractivityCompanies such as Facebook,﻿ Google, and Microsoft﻿ have all developed virtual reality technologies. Within the next ten years, traditional television screens are likely to make way, at least in part, for variations that pair with VR eye-wear and headsets. Evidence of this is already available in Google's development of Google Glass as well as Samsung's foray into wearable accessories that help turn phones into virtual reality machines.What's more, all televisions are likely to become smart TVs within the next ten years.Feel free to ask any additional questions.

Answer: One may wonder if this idea is interesting or insane. Every insane idea is of course interesting: how can one think like that?Largeness is no cause for anything to collapse: indeed, the less insane idea is that some things are too large to collapse: they cannot collapse because they are large.People can deal with large numbers. The trick is that currencies come in denominations. One can send 1 billion dollar with the same ease that he can send 1 dollar. The funny thing is: he does not have to count paper bills 1 by 1 and give a truckload of paper bills. His 1 billion dollar goes from an accounOne may wonder if this idea is interesting or insane. Every insane idea is of course interesting: how can one think like that?Largeness is no cause for anything to collapse: indeed, the less insane idea is that some things are too large to collapse: they cannot collapse because they are large.People can deal with large numbers. The trick is that currencies come in denominations. One can send 1 billion dollar with the same ease that he can send 1 dollar. The funny thing is: he does not have to count paper bills 1 by 1 and give a truckload of paper bills. His 1 billion dollar goes from an account to another account without ever counting one dollar, two dollars, three dollars, and so on.Consider the following as an interesting idea: instead of counting 1000 separate bills each of 1 taka, how about giving a single bill with the word: one thousand taka stamped on it?
